column4: Can anyone tell me how to use a utp cable to give my computer the firmware it needs to boot with my b43 wireless card?
jessicaW: yes
jessicaw: I know the code needed to install it on my current system, which runs version 11.10, but when I try to update to version 12.04 the system refuses to boot
jessicaw: i get a line of text that tells me the machine is missing firware
and it wont' boot at all?
you trying to install your broadcom wireles drivers?
you using precise?
here's this. http://www.howopensource.com/tag/install-broadcom-wireless-driver-on-ubuntu-12-04/
does it make it past grub?
do you see this screen? http://static.howtoforge.com/images/grub2_ubuntu_9.04/big/9.png
or something like it.
try this one.
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Grub2/Submenus?action=AttachFile&do=get&target=g2_submenu.png
that's the grub menu. do you see that after your bios menu?
ok. that's a step in the right direction. what error does it give you exactly?>
what's the EXACT error message.
does it go past that error message and continue to boot?
does the error message go by too fast to read?
sooo, is the problem on the computer your using or a different computer? can you reboot and get the error message? can't really do anything without that.
ahhh. ok. sorry. well, I would try to reboot into 12. write down the error message or take a pic with your phone.
then boot back to 11 and let us know what it is.
did you catch that? what the ubottu just said?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 and then look at RESULTS.txt (or !pastebin it for others to look at)
